title: UConn vs. South Carolina women’s basketball: Score, live updates as Huskies go for 100th straight win | NCAA.com
text:
David Kohl | USA TODAY Sports Images A tough South Carolina team stands in the way of UConn and 100 straight wins. UConn vs. South Carolina women’s basketball: Score, live updates as Huskies go for 100th straight win Ryan Cooper | NCAA.com Contact | Archive | RSS 
The road to an inconceivable 100-game winning streak for UConn only has one more obstacle in its way. But it's a big one, as the No. 6 South Carolina Gamecocks come to Storrs, Connecticut, to try to spoil the fun. 
The Huskies have not lost a game since the beginning of the 2014-15 season. Since then, they've won two national championships and broke their own record winning streak with their 91st straight on Jan. 28. UConn's quest to extend its winning streak into the triple digits has drawn a lot of eyes, and the game will be broadcast on ESPN2. 
But if you can't get in front of a TV, we've got you covered with all the updates, reactions and highlights on a night that will make history no matter who comes out on top. 
No. 1 Connecticut is on the cusp of an unprecedented 100th consecutive win, but one of the nation's top programs stands in its way. No. 6 South Carolina, which is 21-2 this season, has been ranked in the AP Top 10 for the last three seasons. The Huskies are 4-0 all-time against the Gamecocks and have already beaten four other teams currently ranked in the top 10 this season. 
Players to Watch 
South Carolina’s Alaina Coates is averaging a double-double, with 14 points and 11.5 rebounds per game. The senior has 14 double-doubles and has converted 67 percent of her shots, ranking third nationally. Just a sophomore, Katie Lou Samuelson has developed into Connecticut's go-to scorer. She leads the team with 21.4 points per game and is shooting 50.1 percent from the field – including 43.2 percent from 3-point range. 
Key Stats 
Connecticut, which is outscoring its opponents by 33.1 points per game this season, has a 38.7-point average margin of victory during the historic winning streak. South Carolina is outscoring its opponents by 22.1 points per game this season. The Huskies lead the nation with a 52.3 percent field-goal percentage, while the Gamecocks limit opponents to 34.6 percent shooting. Connecticut's Napheesia Collier, who is averaging 19.1 points and a team-high 8.7 rebounds per game, ranks second in the country with a 69.7 percent shooting rate. The Huskies are 8-0 against Top 25 teams this season, while South Carolina is 6-0. Connecticut is forcing 19.2 turnovers per game while averaging 12.3 turnovers per game. A'ja Wilson, who leads South Carolina with 17 points per game, is also hauling in 7.1 rebounds per game. Advertisement
